page.title: 01CRAMOND :Our Domesday Block
page.content: 1 We know most about the part of our D block which is east of the River Almond. This is the heavily populated residential suburb of Edinburgh which has grown up around the old seaside village of Cramond. People like to live in Cramond because of the quietness and beauty of the Almond River, of the Firth of Forth and of the green belt areas in the north west of the city. People come to Cramond for the opportunities for recreation and leisure,to visit the historical sites,to enjoy the wildlife and to follow the shore and river walks. More than half of Cramond D block is the Dalmeny Estate, home of the Earl of Rosebery. Except for the Army Camp at Craigiehall this area is sparsely populated.
